sentences.english: Unless you're privy to divine inspiration, the best thing to do is to watch the process evolve.
sentences.chinese: 除非你知道祕密內情，最好的辦法就是靜觀其變。

sentences.english: I don't think Andrew could have kept that to himself.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲不可能只有安德魯一個人知道內情。

sentences.english: She is a nosey parker and is probably in the know.
sentences.chinese: 她是個愛管閒事的人，可能知道內情的。

sentences.english: The secret to this kind of malicious gossip is not furtiveness.
sentences.chinese: 這種惡毒流言的內情是不會鬼鬼祟祟的。

sentences.english: Employees appreciate being "in the know" and will contribute to improvements and future success.
sentences.chinese: 員工期望知曉決策的內情，有助於進步和未來的成功。

sentences.english: All the more oxygen for the survivors and those in-the-know.
sentences.chinese: 氧氣是屬於生還者及熟知內情的人。

sentences.english: Does not know inside information, red fruit so very happy.
sentences.chinese: 不知內情的紅果於是很高興的去了。

sentences.english: Murdoch cocoon, lay bare the secret behind revealed cases.
sentences.chinese: 默多克層層剝繭，揭露了案件背後的內情。

definition: sth one wishes to keep secret/ulterior motive/a subject best avoided
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
inside information/the ins and outs of the matter/how things stand/what's up
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
an outsider can see things more clearly or objectively than those involved (idiom)
the rise and fall of the terrain (idiom)/(fig.) the whole sequence of events/causes and effects
to turn a blind eye to
to pass on a story/to communicate a message
lit. beat the grass to scare the snake (idiom)/fig. to inadvertently alert an enemy/to punish sb as a warning to others
